I understand that you’re asking about recursive loop protection. I’m happy to put a request in for you on your current account, however, please be aware that recursive loop detection is disabled per-account for a given region. Therefore, when disabled it is disabled for all Lambda functions on a specific region (i.e. us-east-1) for your account. If you’re happy with that, let me know what region(s) you would like to disable on your account. I should be able to get it disabled for you within the day.

Here at AWS support, we cannot provide support around resources that are in different accounts. We take your account security personally and have no way to confirm cross-account ownership and access. With that in mind, please open a support case on the account that owns the resources.

I have opened a request with our service team. Rest assured, I will update you as soon as I hear back from them. 

In the meanwhile, feel free to reach out if you have any further concerns or queries. 

Have a great day ahead! I have put a request through with our internal team. Rest assured, I will update you as soon as I hear back from our team.

Just a kind reminder, that here at AWS Support we do not have visibility into your logging. This is for your security. Therefore, please export your logs from CloudWatch. If you need help, please see the following instructions [reference].

I think a call and a chat over a screenshare would be appropriate. This should expedite investigation and save us from any unnecessary back and forth. Please disclose your number in international format and a good time (Please include your timezone) to call you to organise that. I work from 0900-1700 NZST. Mon - Fri I'd be happy to discuss this over a screenshare with you. Please disclose your number in international format and a good time (Please include your timezone) to call you to organise that. I work from 0900-1700 NZST Mon-Fri
